histogram.name: WebAuthentication.AttestationPromptResult
histogram.summary: Tracks events related to prompting users for permission to pass WebAuthn attestation information back to origins. "Queried" means that the embedder was queried for a decision. (Since such decisions can be resolved by enterprise policy, that doesn't imply that a user saw a permissions prompt in every case.) Then one of four things can happen: a timeout, a positive or negative resolution, or the request is abandoned. The latter case occurs when, for example, the tab is closed or the user navigates away.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.CableV1DiscoveryEvent
histogram.summary: Records events that occur during caBLE v1 authenticator discovery so that potential discovery failures can be identified.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.CableV2.AOADiscoveryEvent
histogram.summary: Records events that happen during the discovery of USB-connected phones.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.CableV2.DiscoveryEvent
histogram.summary: Records events that happen when listening for a caBLEv2 device.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.CableV2.GetAssertionTime
histogram.summary: The time taken between requesting GMS Core to do a GetAssertion operation and the response getting received. Recorded only once the response is received.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.CableV2.MobileEvent
histogram.summary: Records events that occur during a caBLE v2 transaction from the mobile side.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.CableV2.MobileResult
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of caBLEv2 transactions.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.CableV2.RendezvousTime
histogram.summary: The time between the phone connecting to the tunnel server (and thus starting its BLE broadcast) to the point where it receives the handshake message from the desktop.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.CableV2.TunnelEvent
histogram.summary: Records events that occur during the creation of a caBLEv2 tunnel.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.CableV2.TunnelServerError
histogram.summary: Records network and HTTP errors when a tunnel server connection fails. (The HTTP error takes precedence if it's available.)

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.ChromeOS.GetAssertionStatus
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of GetAssertion on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.ChromeOS.MakeCredentialStatus
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of MakeCredential on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.ChromeOS.StartupRecordCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of records of the user's WebAuthn credentials created on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.ChromeOS.U2FClient.IsU2fEnabledDuration
histogram.summary: The duration of a u2fd IsU2fEnabled request.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.ChromeOS.U2FClient.IsU2fEnabledStatus
histogram.summary: Records whether a u2fd IsU2fEnabled DBus call completed successfully or encountered an error.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.ChromeOS.U2FClient.IsUvpaaDuration
histogram.summary: The duration of a u2fd IsUvpaa request.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.ChromeOS.U2FClient.IsUvpaaStatus
histogram.summary: Records whether a u2fd IsUvpaa DBus call completed successfully or encountered an error.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.ChromeOS.UserVerificationRequired
histogram.summary: Records whether the Chrome OS platform authenticator should try to verify the user (instead of requiring power button press). Note that a presence-only request may get upgraded to user-verification. Also note that "true" does not mean the user is actually verified.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.CredentialRequestAllowCredentialsCount
histogram.summary: When a relying party is attempting to authenticate a user using the WebAuthentication API, this metric reports the number of valid credentials that the RP has registered for the user.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.GetAssertionRequestTransport
histogram.summary: Records the transport used for all WebAuthentication GetAssertion requests sent to authenticators. This does not necessarily mean that there was a success response from any given authenticator.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.GetAssertionResponseTransport
histogram.summary: Records the transport used when an authenticator responds with success to a WebAuthentication GetAssertion request.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.IsUVPlatformAuthenticatorAvailable
histogram.summary: Record at startup whether the current system has a platform authenticator available; i.e. whether IsUVPAA JS call would return true or false. This metric is downsampled by factor 10,000 on macOS.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.IsUVPlatformAuthenticatorAvailable2
histogram.summary: Records the result of each Web Authentication PublicKeyCredential.isUserVerifyingPlatformAuthenticatorAvailable() API call.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.MakeCredentialExcludeCredentialsCount
histogram.summary: When a relying party is attempting to register a credential for a new user using the WebAuthentication API, this metric reports the number of existing credentials already registered in order to prevent re-registration.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.MakeCredentialRequestTransport
histogram.summary: Records the transport used for all WebAuthentication MakeCredential requests sent to authenticators. This does not necessarily mean that there was a success response from any given authenticator.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.MakeCredentialResponseTransport
histogram.summary: Records the transport used when an authenticator responds with success to a WebAuthentication MakeCredential request.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.RelyingPartySecurityCheckFailure
histogram.summary: Records failures associated with verifying the relying party origin when that relying party is attempting to make a credential or get an assertion using the WebAuthentication API. Failures include when the relying party's origin is opaque or non-secure, or when the caller-provided relying party ID or app ID is not valid for this origin.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.U2FAttestationPromptResult
histogram.summary: Tracks events related to prompting users for permission to pass U2F attestation information back to origins. "Queried" means that the embedder was queried for a decision. (Since such decisions can be resolved by enterprise policy, that doesn't imply that a user saw a permissions prompt in every case.) Then either a positive or negative result can happen. However, note some complications: a negative will be recorded when the tab is closed or the user navigates away, and a positive result will be recorded when the user accepts the permission prompt but the request has already timed out.
